CWE-94.CWE_Name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
vulnerability: Alice constructs a malicious macro within a MS-Office Word document, which can be considered as code injection. This vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the victim's machine.

CWE-611.CWE_Name: Information Exposure through XML External Entity Reference
vulnerability: Alice embeds an auto-phishing email malware into the document, which can potentially exploit XML external entity (XXE) vulnerabilities. This vulnerability allows an attacker to read arbitrary files on the victim's machine.

Alice disguises the malware as a harmless lucky draw USB driver. This can be considered as an unrestricted file upload vulnerability, where the attacker is able to upload and execute arbitrary files on the victim's machine.
